lines.text: [Annie and Rose watch the men leave on another cattle drive]
I sure wish I was one of 'em.
But you can't be. All you can do is sit here...and hear that tune play...and watch them leave...and wonder if they're going to come back.
You're talking about love...I'm talking about cows!
Somebody once said, "No man's bad enough to be shot in the back."
Old Ben Franklin said, "We shall hang together or, assuredly, we shall all hang separately." Now that fits us, just like it fit them.
Come on, come on. Let's go!
What's the hurry? We're taking a rest, remember?
I'm telling you we got to get out of here!
What's all the rush?
I just robbed a bank!
Alone?
Well, there was only one bank!
I see you still have the habit of sleeping outside.
Yeah, you live longer that way. See, when the shooting starts, I don't have to stop to open the door.
Remember, we, the law, will beat them because right is on our side - and that makes a big difference.
Well, they say a man's the best company when he's alone.
Oh, come on, Melissa! Marry me, please?
Ask me sometime when you're sober, Arkansas.
It's a funny thing. She won't marry me when I'm drunk and I won't marry her when I'm sober.
Bill Doolin - married to a woman!
Yeah, they make the best wives.
You know, this is my first opportunity to show off my new husband.
New husband? Was there an old one?
You're dead, Bill - and I don't want my daughter married to a dead man.
Bill, that jail ain't big, but it looks harder to get into than most jails is to get out of.
And so ended the Doolin Gang. The trails they rode were of their own choosing.
